headline: A Seed in  Darkest  Winter
abstract: The natural world is in convulsions. It’s also poised to begin again.
lead_paragraph: NASHVILLE — For most of my adult life, I wore a red coat when the weather got cold. It started when I was 22 and searching for new outerwear during my first winter in Philadelphia. (It turned out to be my only winter in Philadelphia.) I kept being drawn to a bright red peacoat in a mail-order catalog. Perhaps it reminded me of home in Alabama, the color of the ubiquitous cardinals perched among green pine needles.
